bug.short_desc: [compiler][null] include the effect of 'assert' in syntactic null analysis for fields

long_desc.thetext:
While analyzing the assert, 'str' was correctly marked as checked for null, but at the end of the assert *statement* that information was already expired. This is trivially fixed by applying the same strategy as already used for library asserts like assertNotNull: simply extend the time-to-live of that recorded information. (Fix in AssertStatement).
Additionally, I'm taking the opportunity to improve the analysis when a negation (!) is involved: Previously, only library asserts would exploit negated analysis results, but with a few small tweaks syntactic analysis can now truthfully reflect any negations, too. Please see the tests for more cases that are now correctly recognized.
Released for 4.3 M7 via commit f179c68e167c14230d1517ad0b6adc68e8bc0742
